conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid as it flows from points A, B, C, and D.
Point A: Liquid flows downward and encounters the first baffle (pink).
Liquid from Point A will be directed towards the left side.
Point B: Liquid flows downward and encounters the second baffle (green).
Liquid from Point B will be directed towards the left side.
Point C: Liquid flows downward and encounters the third baffle (light blue).
Liquid from Point C will be directed towards the right side.
Point D: Liquid flows downward and encounters the fourth baffle (white).
Liquid from Point D will be directed towards the right side.
Liquid from Points A and B will continue flowing leftward until it reaches the bottom left corner, entering Container E.
Liquid from Points C and D will continue flowing rightward until it reaches the bottom right corner, entering Container F.
Baffles act as barriers that change the direction of the liquid flow.
Points A and B are on the left side of the baffles.
Points C and D are on the right side of the baffles.
Liquid from points A and B will flow into Container E.
Liquid from points C and D will flow into Container F.
